# Revamp LangPatrol README as mini website (2025-12-02 10:22Z)

_**User (2025-12-10 20:04Z)**_

improve the @README.md file in the root folder heavily. make a mini website out of this. check our website https://www.langpatrol.com  and merge the content from there where possible. the sctructure should be like that. first, the readme should explain what langpatrol is about. then it should tell users that there is the free MIT licensed SDK (OSS) that does many things.





and then it should also cross-link to our hosted cloud solution, that is available to get started for free, which is able to offer even more checks and validation and prompt analysis with a trained and distilled AI model, that would not be possible otherwise via local SDK (the free things explained above).



then the readme should explain a quick start, how to get started (npm install langpatrol, how to call the promptanalyze function for the differen issue codes, how to use the API (our hosted cloud infra), how to get an API key, etc.)



then it should invite the reader to reach out to us founders at founders@langpatrol.com and also to send in feature requests if they are missing anything (at http://langpatrol.com/feature-requests ).

then it should link to the other files



add a nice structure and use md formats to the fullest to make everything easily scanable and digestable, also add those nice buttosn



also backlink to our npm package which is visible at https://www.npmjs.com/package/langpatrol

By providing pre-inference prompt validation, LangPatrol ensures that your prompts are optimized for performance, reducing errors and improving overall model output.<br/><br/>## Features<br/><br/>- **Open-Source SDK**: A free, MIT-licensed Software Development Kit (SDK) that offers a suite of tools for prompt validation and analysis.<br/>- **Cloud Solution**: A hosted cloud platform that provides advanced checks, validation, and prompt analysis using a trained and distilled AI model, offering capabilities beyond the local SDK.<br/><br/>## Getting Started<br/><br/>### Installation<br/><br/>To install the LangPatrol SDK, use npm:<br/><br/>```bash<br/>npm install langpatrol<br/>```<br/><br/>### Quick Start<br/><br/>Here's how to use the `promptAnalyze` function to check for different issue codes:<br/><br/>```javascript<br/>const langpatrol = require('langpatrol');<br/><br/>const prompt = "Your prompt here";<br/>const issues = langpatrol.promptAnalyze(prompt);<br/><br/>if (issues.length > 0) \{<br/>  console.log("Issues found:", issues);<br/>\} else \{<br/>  console.log("No issues detected.");<br/>\}<br/>```<br/><br/>### Using the Cloud API<br/><br/>To leverage the advanced features of our hosted cloud solution:<br/><br/>1. **Get an API Key**: Sign up at [LangPatrol Cloud](https://www.langpatrol.com) to obtain your API key.<br/>2. **Make API Calls**: Use the API key to authenticate and make requests to the cloud API.<br/><br/>For detailed API documentation and usage examples, visit our [API Documentation](https://www.langpatrol.com/api-docs).<br/><br/>## Support and Feedback<br/><br/>We value your feedback and are eager to hear from you:<br/><br/>- **Contact Us**: Reach out to the founders at [founders@langpatrol.com](mailto:founders@langpatrol.com).<br/>- **Feature Requests**: If you have suggestions or feature requests, please submit them at our [Feature Requests Page](https://www.langpatrol.com/feature-requests).<br/><br/>## Additional Resources<br/><br/>- [LangPatrol Website](https://www.langpatrol.com)<br/>- [NPM Package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/langpatrol)<br/><br/>---<br/><br/>*Note: This README is structured to provide a clear and concise overview of LangPatrol, utilizing markdown formatting for easy readability and navigation.*<br/>``` |

@@ -1,21 +1,70 @@
- # LangPatrol
+ &lt;div align="center"&gt;
+ 
+ # üõ°Ô∏è LangPatrol
  
- Developer SDK for pre-inference prompt validation and linting ‚Äî think of it as ESLint or Prettier, but for prompts sent to large language models.
- 
- ## Overview
- 
- Before a developer's app sends a prompt to an LLM like GPT-5, LangPatrol runs a fast, local analysis to catch common prompt bugs that waste tokens or produce unreliable outputs.
+ **Pre-inference prompt validation and linting for LLMs**
+ 
+ [![NPM Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/langpatrol.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/langpatrol)
+ [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](LICENSE)
+ [![Website](https://img.shields.io/badge/Website-langpatrol.com-blue)](https://www.langpatrol.com)
+ 
+ *Think of it as ESLint or Prettier, but for prompts sent to large language models.*
+ 
+ [Get Started](#-quick-start) ‚Ä¢ [Documentation](#-documentation) ‚Ä¢ [Feature Requests](http://langpatrol.com/feature-requests) ‚Ä¢ [Contact Us](#-get-in-touch)
+ 
+ &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## üéØ What is LangPatrol?
+ 
+ LangPatrol is a comprehensive solution designed to enhance the quality and reliability of prompts used in Large Language Models (LLMs). Before your app sends a prompt to an LLM like GPT-4 or Claude, LangPatrol runs fast, local analysis to catch common prompt bugs that waste tokens or produce unreliable outputs.
  
- **Note:** This SDK runs locally only and is not deployed as a service. All analysis happens in your environment.
- 
- We're building LangPatrol in the open ‚Äî expect rough edges as we iterate fast.
- 
- ## Installation
+ **Key Benefits:**
+ - ‚ö° **Fast local analysis** - Runs entirely in your environment
+ - üêõ **Catches prompt bugs** - Detects issues before they reach the LLM
+ - üí∞ **Saves tokens** - Prevents wasted API calls and costs
+ - üéØ **Improves reliability** - Ensures consistent, high-quality outputs
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## üöÄ Two Ways to Use LangPatrol
+ 
+ ### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Free Open-Source SDK (MIT Licensed)
+ 
+ The **LangPatrol SDK** is a free, MIT-licensed, open-source toolkit that provides powerful prompt validation and analysis capabilities. It runs entirely locally in your environment and detects common prompt issues including:
+ 
+ - **MISSING_PLACEHOLDER** - Unresolved template variables (e.g. &#96;{{customer_name}}&#96; not filled)
+ - **MISSING_REFERENCE** - Deictic references ("the report", "continue the list") with no prior content
+ - **CONFLICTING_INSTRUCTION** - Contradictory directives ("be concise" and "give a detailed explanation")
+ - **SCHEMA_RISK** - Prompts requesting JSON but also prose or commentary around it
+ - **TOKEN_OVERAGE** - Estimated token length exceeding model context or cost limits
+ - **INVALID_SCHEMA** - Invalid JSON Schema structure
+ 
+ [![npm package](https://img.shields.io/badge/npm-langpatrol-red)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/langpatrol)
+ 
+ ### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Hosted Cloud Solution (Free Tier Available)
+ 
+ For advanced validation and prompt analysis, check out our **[hosted cloud solution](https://www.langpatrol.com)**. The cloud platform offers:
+ 
+ - ü§ñ **AI-Powered Analysis** - Trained and distilled AI models for deeper prompt understanding
+ - üîç **Domain Context Checking** - Validate prompts against your specific domain/industry
+ - üìä **Advanced Analytics** - Detailed insights and prompt optimization recommendations
+ - ‚ö° **Prompt Optimization** - AI-powered prompt compression to reduce token usage
+ - üöÄ **Scalable Infrastructure** - Handle high-volume analysis with ease
+ 
+ **Get started for free** at [langpatrol.com](https://www.langpatrol.com) - no credit card required.
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ‚ö° Quick Start
+ 
+ ### Installation
  
  &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
  npm install langpatrol
  &#96;&#96;&#96;
  
- ## Quick Start
+ ### Basic Usage
  
  &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript

  &#96;&#96;&#96;
  
- ## Features
- 
- LangPatrol detects five categories of issues:
- 
- 1. **MISSING_PLACEHOLDER** - Unresolved template variables (e.g. &#96;{{customer_name}}&#96; not filled)
- 2. **MISSING_REFERENCE** - Deictic references ("the report", "continue the list") with no prior content
- 3. **CONFLICTING_INSTRUCTION** - Contradictory directives ("be concise" and "give a detailed explanation")
- 4. **SCHEMA_RISK** - Prompts requesting JSON but also prose or commentary around it
- 5. **TOKEN_OVERAGE** - Estimated token length exceeding model context or cost limits
- 
- ## Monorepo Structure
+ ### Using with Message History
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ const report = await analyzePrompt({
+   messages: [
+     { role: 'user', content: 'Here is the sales report: Q3 revenue was $1M' },
+     { role: 'user', content: 'Summarize the report.' }
+   ],
+   model: 'gpt-4'
+ });
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Using with JSON Schema
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ const report = await analyzePrompt({
+   prompt: 'Return user data as JSON.',
+   schema: {
+     type: 'object',
+     properties: {
+       name: { type: 'string' },
+       age: { type: 'number' }
+     },
+     required: ['name', 'age']
+   },
+   model: 'gpt-4'
+ });
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Understanding Issue Codes
+ 
+ Each issue in the report includes a &#96;code&#96; field. Here's how to handle different issue types:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ const report = await analyzePrompt({
+   prompt: 'Continue the list.',
+   model: 'gpt-4'
+ });
+ 
+ // Check for specific issue types
+ const missingRef = report.issues.find(i =&gt; i.code === 'MISSING_REFERENCE');
+ if (missingRef) {
+   console.warn('Missing reference detected:', missingRef.message);
+   // Add context or handle the issue
+ }
+ 
+ const tokenOverage = report.issues.find(i =&gt; i.code === 'TOKEN_OVERAGE');
+ if (tokenOverage) {
+   console.warn('Token limit exceeded:', tokenOverage.message);
+   // Truncate or summarize the prompt
+ }
+ 
+ const placeholder = report.issues.find(i =&gt; i.code === 'MISSING_PLACEHOLDER');
+ if (placeholder) {
+   console.warn('Unresolved placeholder:', placeholder.message);
+   // Fill in template variables
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ‚òÅÔ∏è Using the Cloud API
+ 
+ The cloud API provides advanced features like AI-powered analysis, domain context checking, and prompt optimization.
+ 
+ ### Get Your API Key
+ 
+ 1. Sign up at [langpatrol.com](https://www.langpatrol.com) (free tier available)
+ 2. Navigate to your dashboard
+ 3. Copy your API key from the settings page
+ 
+ ### Basic Cloud API Usage
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ import { analyzePrompt } from 'langpatrol';
+ 
+ const report = await analyzePrompt({
+   prompt: 'Generate a marketing email for our SaaS product',
+   model: 'gpt-4',
+   options: {
+     apiKey: process.env.LANGPATROL_API_KEY,
+     apiBaseUrl: 'https://api.langpatrol.com' // Optional, defaults to production
+   }
+ });
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Domain Context Checking (Cloud-only)
+ 
+ Validate that prompts match your domain activity:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ const report = await analyzePrompt({
+   prompt: 'Generate a marketing email for our SaaS product',
+   model: 'gpt-4',
+   options: {
+     apiKey: process.env.LANGPATROL_API_KEY,
+     check_context: {
+       domains: ['saas', 'marketing', 'email', 'software']
+     }
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ if (report.issues.find(i =&gt; i.code === 'OUT_OF_CONTEXT')) {
+   console.warn('Prompt is out of context for your domain');
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Prompt Optimization (Cloud-only)
+ 
+ Compress prompts to reduce token usage:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ import { optimizePrompt } from 'langpatrol';
+ 
+ const optimized = await optimizePrompt({
+   prompt: 'Write a detailed project proposal for building a new mobile app...',
+   model: 'gpt-4',
+   options: {
+     apiKey: process.env.LANGPATROL_API_KEY
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ console.log('Compression ratio:', optimized.ratio);
+ console.log('Tokens saved:', optimized.origin_tokens - optimized.optimized_tokens);
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## üìö Documentation

  This is a pnpm workspace monorepo:

- - &#96;packages/engine&#96; - Core analysis engine (Elastic License 2.0)

- - &#96;apps/devserver&#96; - Express API for testing
- - &#96;apps/devui&#96; - React/Vite UI for interactive testing
- 
- ## Development
  
  &#96;&#96;&#96;bash

## Improvements

1. Header with badges: NPM version, license, and website links

   - What is LangPatrol (overview and benefits)
   - Two ways to use it (SDK vs Cloud)
   - Quick start with examples
   - Cloud API usage guide
   - Documentation links
   - Contact information

3. Visual elements:
   - Badges for NPM, license, and website
   - Emojis for scanability
   - Centered header and footer
   - Clear section dividers

4. Content:
   - Explains the free open-source SDK
   - Cross-links to the hosted cloud solution
   - Shows how to use `analyzePrompt` with different issue codes
   - Explains how to get and use an API key
   - Includes contact info (founders@langpatrol.com)
   - Links to feature requests page
   - Links to npm package
   - Links to all documentation files

5. Examples: code examples for basic usage, message history, JSON schema, issue code handling, cloud API, domain context checking, and prompt optimization

The README is structured like a mini website with clear navigation, visual hierarchy, and all requested information. The license section reflects the current Elastic License 2.0 while emphasizing that the SDK is free and open-source.
